lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
public int parse(String command) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("\t☹ OOPS!!! Please specify the task number for the task " +
System.out.println("\t☹ OOPS!!! Please input a task number instead.");
throw new DukeException("\t☹ OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("\t☹ OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("You've entered a date in an invalid format! " +
"\nIt should be in the form: yyyy-mm-dd");
throw new DukeException("\t☹ OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("\t☹ OOPS!!! Please specify the task number for the task " +
System.out.println("\t☹ OOPS!!! Please input a task number instead.");
throw new DukeException("\t☹ OOPS!!! You have entered an invalid command, please try again!");
System.out.println("Hello I'm duke.Duke\nWhat can I do for you?");
System.out.println("\tBye. Hope to see you again soon!");
public static void printDeleteMessage(Task task, int taskCount) {
System.out.println("\tNoted. I've removed this task:\n\t  " + task);
public static void printAddedMessage(Task task, int taskCount) {
System.out.println("\tGot it. I've added this duke.task.Task:\n" + "\t  " + task);
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + taskCount + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("\t☹ OOPS!!! This is not a valid task number.");
System.out.println("\tHere are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("\tYou don't have any tasks in your list!");
System.out.println("\t☹ OOPS!!! This is not a valid task number.");
